item.title: HTML and CSS Builders: Overview and Comparison
item.description:
HTML/CSS builders significantly simplify the website creation process. They allow you to visually assemble pages while generating clean, responsive code under the hood. These tools are perfect for designers, beginner developers, and even professionals looking to speed up prototyping and MVP (Minimum Viable Product) creation.

Advantages

  • Clean and responsive code output: Most modern builders aim for semantic, responsive HTML/CSS/JS that works well across devices.
  • Low entry barrier: You don‚Äôt need in-depth knowledge of HTML or CSS to start building interfaces ‚Äî basic understanding and web design principles are enough.
  • High development and prototyping speed: These tools enable quick idea validation, functional prototypes, and MVPs, greatly accelerating development cycles.
  • Reduced costs: For simple projects or startups, using a builder may be significantly cheaper than hiring a full dev team.

Disadvantages

  • Platform dependency: Some solutions only work in the cloud or offer limited code export. You may be locked into their ecosystem, making migration harder.
  • Limitations for complex or custom projects: Without solid knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, it can be difficult to build unique or highly dynamic components.
  • Potential code bloat or inefficiency: Even if the code is clean, it may not be as optimized as that written by an experienced developer.
  • Learning curve of the builder itself: Despite the low barrier to HTML/CSS, you still need to spend time learning the builder’s UI and logic.

Comparison Table of Popular HTML/CSS Builders

Name Type Cross-Platform Code Generation Export Support Best For Pricing Highlights
Webflow Cloud ‚úÖ Browser-based ‚úÖ Clean HTML/CSS ‚úÖ (HTML/CSS/JS) Designers, developers Free plan + paid tiers Built-in CMS, advanced animations, hosting
Webstudio Cloud ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Clean Code ‚úÖ No-code/low-code projects Free, open source Open source alternative to Webflow
Bootstrap Studio Desktop ‚úÖ Windows/macOS/Linux ‚úÖ Bootstrap-based ‚úÖ Frontend developers Paid (one-time license) Built on Bootstrap, rapid prototyping
Brick for WP WP Plugin ‚ùå WP-only ‚úÖ Within WordPress ‚ùå WP-only WordPress site creators Free and paid Deep WP integration, no-code experience
Framer Cloud ‚úÖ ‚ùå JSX (React) üö´ Hosting only Designers, prototyping Free plan + paid Animations, interactive, React-first
Pinegrow Desktop ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Full control ‚úÖ Developers Paid (subscription or one-time) Tailwind, WP, Bootstrap support
Siter.io Cloud ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Clean Code ‚úÖ Designers Free plan + paid Simple UI, fast one-page builder

Conclusion

If you’re creating landing pages, prototypes, personal websites, or simple corporate pages, these tools can save a lot of time and resources.

However, for building complex web apps, dynamic portals, or high-load e-commerce platforms where performance and unique business logic are critical, in-depth frontend knowledge (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, frameworks) is essential.

Best practice: combine visual editors with manual code refinement. This ensures flexibility, performance, and the ability to build truly custom functionality. The right tool always depends on your project‚Äôs goals, team, and scale.

item.title: Where to Find Tilda Modifications: A Curated Resource List
item.description:
Tilda is great. But it can be even better! Where to find enhancements for your website?

Tilda is an incredibly user-friendly platform for quickly building websites without the hassle. You‚Äôve probably already appreciated its capabilities ‚Äî in just a few hours, you can create a site that looks great and works well. But what if you want more? Maybe you‚Äôd like a button that animates on hover, or a portfolio section that behaves differently from standard blocks?

This is where built-in Tilda features, however powerful, might start to feel a bit… predictable.

Modifications ‚Äî the secret ingredients that make your site truly unique

Think of modifications like spices in cooking: they enhance your project with personality, depth, and new features. If you‚Äôve ever wanted a special animation or unique interaction that Tilda doesn‚Äôt offer out of the box ‚Äî chances are, someone has already built it. And if not, you‚Äôll definitely be inspired to create your own after reading this article.

I‚Äôve compiled a list of the most valuable and interesting resources to help turn your good website into something truly impressive.

Why use modifications on your Tilda site?

Imagine your site is a dish from a fine restaurant. Tilda gives you the basic ingredients and recipes, but modifications add flavor. They allow you to:

  • Stand out: Break free from template designs and make your site visually distinctive.
  • Add new features: Implement forms, animations, filters, and other functionality not available in the default builder.
  • Improve UX: Create a more interactive, memorable, and user-friendly experience.
  • Optimize your workflow: Automate routine tasks and make content management easier.

Where to find Tilda modifications?

1. Pioneers and time-tested libraries

  • Mo-Ti.ru ‚Äî One of the first and most reliable resources for Tilda customizations, with solutions for nearly any task.
  • Roman-Kosov.ru ‚Äî A developer’s site offering stylish and clever enhancements for Tilda projects.
  • Drik.dev ‚Äî High-quality modifications including product comparison tools and advanced Zero Block effects.

2. Curated libraries and marketplaces

  • Ticode.dev ‚Äî A broad collection of effects and custom scripts, from cursor animations to complex interactivity.
  • Nolim.cc ‚Äî A marketplace packed with mod options, often available via subscription.

3. Sliders and galleries

  • Slider.direktoriya.site ‚Äî For next-level sliders and galleries that go beyond Tilda‚Äôs built-in options.

4. Browser extensions: one-click magic

  • Annexx.cc ‚Äî A browser extension that saves time and automates the way you integrate mods.
  • Voron-dev.ru ‚Äî Another useful extension to streamline your daily work with Tilda.

5. Blogs, studios & creative communities

  • Mod.tistols.com ‚Äî Modifications by the Tistols Studio ‚Äî always stylish and functional.
  • Anku.im/blog ‚Äî A compact but informative blog sharing clever Tilda tips and tricks.
  • Ilda.top ‚Äî A full library of resources tailored to the Tilda ecosystem.
  • Necodim.ru ‚Äî More than just mods ‚Äî also a training hub focused on Tilda and other no-code tools.
  • Dsgnmax.ru/useful ‚Äî A set of visually rich and polished modifications for those who want a premium look.

6. Widget libraries (for plug-and-play solutions)

  • Elfsight.com/tilda-widgets ‚Äî Over 70 ready-to-use widgets: contact forms, social feeds, chat integrations, countdowns, and more. No coding required.

Tips for working with modifications

  • Master Zero Block ‚Äî Most advanced enhancements are built using it. Think of it as your creative playground.
  • Test for compatibility ‚Äî Always check new modifications on a test page to avoid conflicts with existing elements.
  • Back up your project ‚Äî Before applying major changes or inserting custom code, save a full backup.
  • Experiment fearlessly ‚Äî Try, fail, and try again. This is the fastest way to learn and discover new tricks.

Final thoughts

Modifications aren‚Äôt just technical add-ons ‚Äî they‚Äôre creative tools that help your site stand out. Whether you use pre-made solutions or build your own, you‚Äôll quickly see how flexible and powerful Tilda can be.

Know more awesome resources for Tilda mods? Share them in the comments!

item.title: Useful Browser Extensions
item.description:
1. AdGuard AdBlocker ‚Äî Ad Blocking

In the age of information overload, distracting ads can disrupt your focus. A good ad blocker is essential ‚Äî one of the best is AdGuard AdBlocker.

Installation link:
AdGuard AdBlocker on Chrome Web Store

Or search manually in your browser‚Äôs extension store:

  • Chrome, Opera, Edge: chromewebstore.google.com
  • Firefox: addons.mozilla.org
  • Search term: AdGuard AdBlocker

Configuration

  1. Click the extension icon ‚Üí click the gear icon to open settings.
  2. In the Filters section, enable:
    • Ad Blocking
    • Privacy
    • Annoyances (blocks pop-ups like “Install Yandex Browser”)
    • Language-specific filters (e.g., Russian or your preferred language)
  3. Go to Tracking Protection to block trackers, including ad trackers.
  4. To manually block stubborn elements:
    • Right-click the extension icon ‚Üí Block ads manually
    • Hover over the element and click to block.

P.S. I’m not against ads ‚Äî but popups and phishing banners are just too much.

2. Wappalyzer ‚Äî Website Technology Profiler

Wappalyzer is a handy tool to find out what technologies a website uses.

How to use:
After installation, click the extension icon to view data about the site’s CMS, analytics tools, plugins, and more (especially useful for WordPress sites).

3. Alaev SEO Tools ‚Äî Express SEO Audit

Alaev SEO Tools provides a quick SEO overview of any webpage.

Features:

  • Overview ‚Äî meta tags (title, description), headings H1‚ÄìH6, sitemap status
  • Page ‚Äî highlight H1‚ÄìH6, check for missing alt tags, word count, reindexing in Yandex Webmaster, and PageSpeed testing
  • Links ‚Äî view internal/external links and follow/nofollow attributes
  • Images ‚Äî audit images for missing alt attributes
  • Structured Data ‚Äî inspect OpenGraph and Twitter metadata

‚ùó This is a quick audit, not a full-scale analysis.
For full audits, use:

  • üá∑üá∫ be1.ru, pr-cy.ru, rush-analytics.ru
  • üåç similarweb.com, semrush.com, ahrefs.com

4. Yandex Wordstat Assistant ‚Äî Keyword Collection Tool

To collect keywords from Yandex Wordstat, use Yandex Wordstat Assistant.

Install from:

  • Chrome
  • Opera
  • Firefox

How it works:
Visit wordstat.yandex.ru ‚Äî a panel will appear on the left side of the page.

Main functions:

  • Add keywords from the list
  • Copy keywords with or without frequency
  • Sort keywords alphabetically
  • Delete unnecessary queries

Copy your keyword list to Excel for analysis, clustering, and further SEO or ad campaign planning.

5. Font Finder ‚Äî Inspect Web Fonts

Use Font Finder to inspect any text element on a webpage.

What you can view:

  • Font family
  • Size
  • Color
  • Styling properties (e.g., bold, italic)

Install from:

  • Chrome / Edge
  • Opera
  • Firefox

6. ColorZilla ‚Äî Color Picker Tool

Pick any color from a webpage with ColorZilla. The hex code is automatically copied to the clipboard.

Extras:

  • Color Picker Panel ‚Äî saves color history
  • Press Esc to deactivate the tool

Install from:

  • Chrome / Edge
  • Firefox
  • Opera

7. GoFullPage ‚Äî Full Page Screenshots

GoFullPage ‚Äì Full Page Screen Capture takes full-length screenshots of web pages.

How to use:

  1. Install the extension
  2. Click the icon to start capture
  3. Save the result as PNG or PDF

Install from:

  • Chrome / Edge
  • Not available for Firefox
  • In Opera, install as a Chrome extension
